net.sourceforge.waters.model.des

Interface TraceProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TraceElement

    public interface TraceProxy
extends Proxy

    A execution sequence for some automata of a product DES.

    A trace consists of an alternating sequence of states and events that can be executed by several synchronised automata. The state information is optional for deterministic automata as it can be computed from the automata in this case.

    For nondeterministic automata, state information is required, and it is stored in a sequence of trace steps (TraceStepProxy) as follows. The first step represents the initial states of the automata, and each following step contains an event and the state reached by the automata after executing this event.

    Traces can be computed as part of counterexamples (CounterExampleProxy), or be obtained by simulation.

    Author:
    Robi Malik

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sourceforge.waters.model.base.Proxy

        acceptVisitor, clone, getProxyInterface

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this trace. The name can identify or describe a trace more precisely in counterexamples that have more than one trace. It may be an empty string in all other cases.

      • getEvents

        List<EventProxy> getEvents()
        Gets the sequence of events constituting this trace.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of objects of type EventProxy.

      • getTraceSteps

        List<TraceStepProxy> getTraceSteps()
        Gets the sequence of states and events constituting this trace. This method returns a list of TraceStepProxy objects, each consisting of a pair of incoming event and target state. The first entry has a null event and the initial state as its target state, while every other entry has a non-null event and the state reached after that event.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of objects of type TraceStepProxy.

      • getLoopIndex

        int getLoopIndex()
        Gets the start position of the cycle in a cyclic trace. The loop index identifies the number of the step (starting at 0) in the trace where the loop starts. If the trace has steps 0,...,n, and the loop index is at position i, then it represents the loop 0,...,n,i,...,n,...
        Returns:
        The index of the trace step starting a cycle, or -1 if it is not a cyclic trace.
